name: gridlab-d
description:
Autotools package for Gridlab-D, a new power distribution system
simulation and analysis tool that provides valuable information to users
who design and operate distribution systems, and to utilities that wish
to take advantage of the latest energy technologies. Gridlab-D is a
flexible simulation environment that can be integrated with a variety of
third-party data management and analysis tools.

dependencies.name: gnuconfig
dependencies.description:
The GNU config.guess and config.sub scripts versioned by timestamp.
This package can be used as a build dependency for autotools packages
that ship a tarball with outdated config.guess and config.sub files.

dependencies.name: autoconf
dependencies.description: Autoconf -- system configuration part of autotools

dependencies.name: automake
dependencies.description: Automake -- make file builder part of autotools

dependencies.name: libtool
dependencies.description: libtool -- library building part of autotools.

dependencies.name: m4
dependencies.description: GNU M4 is an implementation of the traditional Unix macro processor.

dependencies.name: xerces-c
dependencies.description:
Xerces-C++ is a validating XML parser written in a portable subset of
C++. Xerces-C++ makes it easy to give your application the ability to
read and write XML data. A shared library is provided for parsing,
generating, manipulating, and validating XML documents using the DOM,
SAX, and SAX2 APIs.

dependencies.name: superlu-mt
dependencies.description:
SuperLU is a general purpose library for the direct solution of large,
sparse, nonsymmetric systems of linear equations on high performance
machines. SuperLU_MT is designed for shared memory parallel machines.

dependencies.name: helics
dependencies.description:
HELICS is a general-purpose, modular, highly-scalable co-simulation
framework that runs cross-platform (Linux, Windows, and Mac OS X) and
supports both event driven and time series simulation.
